reasoning: Creating new SQLAlchemy models following well-established patterns in the codebase. Involves 2 files, single service, no external integrations. Bilingual fields (_he suffix) are a new pattern but straightforward to implement. Many-to-many relationship pattern already exists in codebase.

scope.notes: New model file (equipment_template.py) plus updating __init__.py to export new models. All changes contained to backend/app/models/ directory.

integrations.notes: Uses only existing SQLAlchemy dependencies. No external APIs or services involved. JSONB pattern already used in Equipment model.

infrastructure.notes: Database migration will be needed to create tables, but migration creation is not part of this task scope. Models only.

knowledge.notes: All patterns exist in codebase: UUID primary keys, JSONB fields, many-to-many relationships via junction tables, Enum definitions, timestamps. Bilingual fields (_he) are new but straightforward.

concerns: ConsultantType implementation choice (enum vs table) - recommend table for extensibility
JSONB field default values must be properly set (dict/list)
Bilingual fields are new pattern - need to ensure consistency
risk.notes: Low risk as this only defines model structure. No data manipulation or external integrations. Proper SQLAlchemy syntax is critical.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Model definitions only with no immediate data impact. Validation should verify proper SQLAlchemy syntax, relationships are correctly defined, and models can be imported without errors.
